EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────────────
###Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)  
– Burner Inserter (“new factory”) at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)  
– Dedicated Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5)  
– Burner Inserter (fuelled with coal) at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5)  
– Assembling Machine (assembling-machine-1) at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)  
Use-case: Processes copper plates into copper cables by delivering materials (via inserters and chest) to the assembling unit.

###Belt Depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden Chest (serving as the belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)  
– Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)  
– Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5)  
Use-case: Provides an isolated depot to bridge the extraction output and the factory interface by receiving items and channeling them via belt connections.

###Extraction System at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)  
Use-case: Acts as the source for delivering items (e.g. copper plates) into the transport network.

###Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Generator (steam-engine) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)  
– Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)  
– Offshore Pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)  
Use-case: Generates electricity and manages fluid input for factory operations.

────────────────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – When connecting transport belts, ensure that the target entity is an inserter (or a similar compatible receiver) rather than a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always add an interfacing inserter to input items into the target.

• Placement Distance Errors  
 – Verify that the player is within the allowable placement range before attempting to place an entity. If an error indicates the target position is too far (as with the wooden chest), move closer to meet the maximum distance requirement.

• Inventory and Undefined Variable Errors  
 – Confirm that required items (for example, a wooden chest) are present in the inventory prior to attempting placement or craft them if missing.  
 – Ensure all variable names are correctly defined and referenced to prevent NameError issues (e.g. referencing ‘target_chest’ only after it has been properly set).
